required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Class III Elastics on Stability of Orthopaedic Class III Correction
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Class III Elastics on Stability of Orthopaedic Class III Correction

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of adding elastics to orthodontic retainers on the stability of class III correction and whether it reduces the need for jaw surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Over the years many types of appliances have been recommended for retaining Class III correction in growing children such as intermaxillary splints, class III activator, Frankel 3, Class III twin block, continued use of face-mask and chin-cup. However, currently none of these are in routine use and there is no evidence on the long term effectiveness of any retention protocol for class III correction.
One of the most commonly used retainers following orthodontic treatment is clear plastic retainers. There are no studies that investigated whether using class III elastics in combination with clear plastic retainers improves the stability of class III correction and reduces the need for later jaw surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in overjet of participants in the 2 study arms

secondary_outcome.description: Need for surgery assessed by a panel of orthodontists
The difference in SNA angle measured on cephalometric radiographs between groups
The difference in SNB angle measured on cephalometric radiographs between groups
The difference in ANB angle measured on cephalometric radiographs between groups
The difference in upper incisor angle measured on cephalometric radiographs between groups
The difference in lower incisor angle measured on cephalometric radiographs between groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Compliance and ease of use of both retention regimens
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire on the frequency and ease of use of both retainer regimens will be used

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of elastics on alignment retention
secondary_outcome.description: Little's irregularity index will be used to compare both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Periodontal health, including recession around the incisors
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of gingival recession and prominence of lower incisors will be evaluated for both groups

arm_group.arm_group_label: Upper-lower clear plastic retainers + Class III elastics
arm_group.description: Upper-lower clear plastic retainers + Class III elastics

intervention.intervention_name: Upper-lower clear plastic retainers + Class III elastics
intervention.description: Addition of Class III elastics to clear plastic retainers
intervention.arm_group_label: Upper-lower clear plastic retainers + Class III elastics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients that completed their orthodontic treatment for the management of their skeletal class III with upper jaw retrusion that was treated with Class III orthopaedic appliances, followed by full fixed appliances.
- No congenital anomalies or craniofacial syndromes
- No other orthodontic treatment
- No medical history that effects growth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital anomalies or craniofacial syndromes
- Other orthodontic treatment
- Medical history that effects growth

overall_official.affiliation: Sydney Local Health District, The University of Sydney
